message.content:
We start by extracting the required values from the provided statements.

Step 1. Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio:
 • From the balance sheet, Total Assets (End_amount) = 14,089,860.66.
 • Also from the balance sheet, Total Owner’s Equity (End_amount) = 11,598,563.11.
 • Therefore, Total Liabilities = Total Assets − Total Owner’s Equity = 14,089,860.66 − 11,598,563.11 = 2,491,297.55.
 • The Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets = 2,491,297.55 / 14,089,860.66 ≈ 0.1767, which rounds to 0.18.

Step 2. Calculate the Gross Profit Margin:
 • From the income statement, Gross Profit = 1,535,951.24.
 • Total Revenue = 7,825,951.24.
 • Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100 = (1,535,951.24 / 7,825,951.24) × 100 ≈ 19.63%.

Step 3. Calculate the Operating Cash Flow Ratio:
 • From the cash flow statement, Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –4,398,760.38.
 • And from the balance sheet, Total Current Liabilities = 2,491,297.55.
 • Operating Cash Flow Ratio = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities / Total Current Liabilities = –4,398,760.38 / 2,491,297.55 ≈ –1.7648, which rounds to –1.76.

Thus, the solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.18",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "19.63%",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-1.76"
  }
}
